data.text: @trinafraser It’s so tough when a potential client contacts us inquiring about submitting an application then I see press releases from them on Twitter... 🛒🐎

@Onya_Ganja Depends on your definition of notable. Light and heat definitely contribute to the degredation of THC which creates CBN over time, so you will have more CBN in your cannabis, but it may be not be that much. I wonder what the time/heat/light ratio is to create the max CBN?

@Onya_Ganja @watershedbrew @trichomics Agree 2 disagree? Names r cool & good for marketing, but 4 the medical market it's tough 4 some patients out there. And I do think there's a big line between anxiety reduction and sleepiness. I would hate to walk around all tired and sleepy during the day from my anxiety meds. 😁
@Onya_Ganja @watershedbrew @trichomics And I would hope LPs are storing cannabis properly as to avoid maximum degredation of THC and CBD.

@Onya_Ganja @watershedbrew @trichomics That's exactly my point. We need to move away from strain names and start educating patients based on what's in the plant and not the name. That's why I say strain names are BS....high CBN would just make you sleepy. Proper storage is another thing we all need to educate users on

@Onya_Ganja @watershedbrew @trichomics It does when u r a med patient & hv been getting great results 4 say, anxiety from a certain strain called XX bcs it's high in Carryophyllene. But then they run out. So u go 2 ur other LP and they have XX, but way lower Carryophyllene & more myrcene. Different effects, same name.
@MAU5NER Misunderstandings of the federal and provincial frameworks. What will and will not be permitted.

@watershedbrew @trichomics @Onya_Ganja Sort of. There's standards in place for the product today, but not so much for the cultivars (strains) themselves. Even a cutting from the same mother can vary if say the two are grown in different mediums, fed different nutrients etc. What we need are appellations for Cannabis.

@Hartsteinfeld @trichomics @Onya_Ganja So if a standard was put in place a strain would have to meet certain standards before being allowed to be called a certain name? Unrealistic though I'm guessing?

@watershedbrew @trichomics @Onya_Ganja True, but I'm talking more about the fact that a lot of medical patients rely on strain names for certain medicinal effects, but things like environment, nutrients, etc can play a huge factor in changing a plant. So, 'Sour Diesel' from one LP to the next can have huge variations

@trichomics @Onya_Ganja @Hartsteinfeld The cartoonish strain names don't exactly help legitimize it as an industry in the eyes of the uninformed.

Ex: 

Barley: Copeland, Syngenta, Metcalfe

Weed: Romulan, Lowryder, The Purps

Still sounds like a bunch of burnt out frat boys are having naming parties.
@Onya_Ganja @trinafraser The truth is out there https://t.co/aKZHDbeLzv
@Onya_Ganja @trinafraser Yup, that's why strain names are complete BS. We need to start educating about cannabinoids and terpenes for effects rather than just names.
@trinafraser Any examples of specific inaccuracies; not specific press releases per se, but types of misinformation that you see often
